question_sentence: Which country suspended all football league fixtures after a club president punched a referee at the end of a match?
evidence: Referee Halil Umut Meler was punched to the ground by MKE Ankaragucu president Faruk Koca, and then kicked after fans invaded the pitch, following a 1-1 Super Lig draw with Rizespor in Ankara on Monday. Koca was arrested and the Turkish football federation halted all matches, before later ruling that the league could resume on 19 December.

question_sentence: Which online dentistry company shut down its global operations this week after going bust?
evidence: The US-based company, which sold teeth-straightening aligners, announced that it was closing down "immediately", two months after filing for bankruptcy – leaving many customers feeling "confused and stranded", said the BBC. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which celebrity donated $1 million to residents in tornado-ravaged Tennessee?
evidence: The singer-songwriter donated to the Tennessee Emergency Response Fund after deadly tornadoes ripped through the region last weekend. "Nashville is my home and the fact that so many people have lost their homes and so much more in Middle Tennessee is devastating to me," Swift said on Instagram.

question_sentence: Judges in England and Wales were given the green light to use which online tool to help write legal rulings?
evidence: New guidance from the Judicial Office says that AI can be used to summarise large amounts of text or for administrative tasks. But judges were warned not to conduct legal research or analysis, as chatbots are prone to making up fictitious cases.

question_sentence: Baseball star Shohei Ohtani signed a record-breaking $700 million contract with which US team?
evidence: Ohtani is the highest-paid player in MLB history after signing the 10-year contract, following the expiration of his contract with the Los Angeles Angels. The Japanese star has agreed to defer $680 million of his historic pay deal until 2034, so that his new team has more cash to enlist other new players.

question_sentence: In which city did Vladimir Putin confirm that he will run for re-election next year?
evidence: Putin ended months of speculation when he confirmed his bid for another six-year term as president, during a military awards ceremony at the Kremlin. His expected victory in elections scheduled to take place in March paves the way for him to remain in power until 2036 – by which point he would have surpassed Joseph Stalin's 29 years to become Russia's longest-serving leader.

question_sentence: Sports Illustrated CEO Ross Levinsohn was fired after the magazine was accused of what?
evidence: Levinsohn was fired weeks after tech website Futurism reported that Sports Illustrated had published several articles with fake author names and headshots from an AI-generated image website. The content was removed from the magazine's website, but published The Arena Group disputed the report's accuracy and said this week that Levinsohn had been sacked to "improve the operational efficiency and revenue of the company".

question_sentence: Argentina's newly inaugurated President Javier Milei devalued the peso by how much as part of his economic "shock therapy"?
evidence: Milei is slashing the value of Argentina's currency, the peso, against the US dollar as part of emergency measures to help the nation's struggling economy. The far-right president has also announced massive spending cuts since being sworn in on Sunday.

question_sentence: How much did Hayao Miyazaki's new film "The Boy and the Heron" earn in the US and Canada in its opening weekend?
evidence: The long-awaited animated fantasy from Miyazaki's Studio Ghibli is the first original anime title in history to top the North American box office chart. The film is getting rave reviews but is rumoured to be the last from 82-year-old Miyazaki.

question_sentence: King Charles is facing criticism for appointing as head of the royal medical household a doctor who has advocated for what?
evidence: Dr Michael Dixon, "a champion of faith healing and herbalism", has "quietly" held the senior position for the last year, The Sunday Times reported last weekend. Dixon's duties include having overall responsibility for the health of the King and the wider royal family, and potentially even representing them in talks with government.

question_sentence: Which world leader met with President Joe Biden at the White House this week?
evidence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky made a trip to Washington on Tuesday to deliver an impassioned plea for more US aid to fight constant Russian bombardment.

question_sentence: Which Ivy League school named a new president this week following intense criticism from donors?
evidence: University of Pennsylvania President Liz Magill resigned after facing criticism over her perceived inaction in combatting antisemitism on the school’s campus. Larry Jameson, the school’s longest-serving dean, was tapped to serve as interim president during the moment of crisis.

question_sentence: Which awards show announced its 2024 nominees this week?
evidence: The nominees for the 81st Golden Globe Awards were announced Monday, but it appears the show’s organizers are having a hard time finding someone to host.

question_sentence: Which term was Google’s most-searched news trend in 2023?
evidence: Google’s top trending term in the US and globally was “War in Israel and Gaza,” the company announced Monday. Other leading topics included NFL player Damar Hamlin, the “Barbie” and “Oppenheimer” movies, and the late actor Matthew Perry.

question_sentence: What type of agreement was reached between dozens of countries this week?
evidence: The world agreed to a new climate deal in Dubai on Wednesday at the COP28 summit after two weeks of painstaking talks. The agreement marks the first time the annual UN meeting has asked countries to move away from fossil fuels — the main driver of the climate crisis.

question_sentence: Which toy will no longer be sold by Amazon, Target and Walmart due to safety concerns?
evidence: Major retailers have voluntarily stopped selling water beads marketed for children. Water beads are tiny balls made out of extremely absorbent polymer material that can expand up to 100 times their size when exposed to liquid. Health experts say they can cause intestinal blockages if injested.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled nearly 2 million vehicles this week?
evidence: Tesla is recalling nearly all 2 million of its vehicles on US roads for an important Autopilot update.

question_sentence: Which state was devastated by a series of tornadoes that left more than 35,000 customers without power?
evidence: Tennessee officials are assessing the damage after tornadoes and strong thunderstorms roared across the state, leaving at least six dead and multiple buildings destroyed.

question_sentence: According to early polling, which candidate appears to be the most likely Republican nominee in next year’s presidential election?
choices: Former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley
evidence: Despite a plethora of legal woes, former President Donald Trump is the clear front-runner in the GOP race. Early polling suggests Trump currently has the upper hand over President Joe Biden in two critical battleground states — Michigan and Georgia.

question_sentence: Which pro sports league announced it will play a game in Brazil during the 2024 season?
evidence: The National Football League (NFL) announced that São Paulo, Brazil, will host a regular-season game next year, the first ever in South America.

question_sentence: Who made the largest-ever donation by an alumnus to Delaware State University during the “Scholarship Ball” event?
choices: Steve Ewing, an automotive executive and 1983 graduate of then-Delaware State College

question_sentence: Who is starring as The Nutcracker in the Wilmington Ballet’s 56th annual production of “The Nutcracker”?
What was the focus of the latest referendum for the Appoquinimink School District?
What key recommendation was made in the independent assessment of Delaware’s education funding system?
choices: Increase overall state investment in public education.
Implement a weighted student funding formula for the state.

question_sentence: On what date did Randon Wilkerson brutally attack Delmar Police Cpl. Keith Heacook, leading to his death?
Why was the latest Panera Charged Lemonade lawsuit filed in Delaware?
choices: Because the plaintiff, Dennis Brown, had a chromosomal deficiency disorder.
Because the Delaware Superior Court has a reputation for handling high-profile cases.
Because the family of Sarah Katz, the first lawsuit plaintiff, requested it.

question_sentence: What is the projected number of Americans expected to travel 50 miles or more between Christmas and New Year’s this year, according to AAA’s holiday forecast?
What is the historic probability of Delaware having at least an inch of snow on the ground on Christmas, based on United States climate normals from 1991-2020?
What is the name of the first wine released by Elena Delle Donne’s brand, Deldon Wines?
Which football conference will Delaware be joining in 2025 after moving up to the Football Bowl Subdivision (FBS)?
